x_symbol.description: A UL-based menu with unlimited levels and many other features.
x_symbol.syntax: xMenu6(sUlId, sMainUlClass, sSubUlClass, sLblLiClass, sItmLiClass, sLblAClass, sItmAClass[, sPlusImg, sMinusImg, sImgClass, sItmPadLeft, bLblIsItm, sActiveItmId])

par.name: sUlId
par.note: The ID string of the outermost UL.

par.name: sMainUlClass
par.note: The className string that will be applied to the sUlId element.

par.name: sSubUlClass
par.note: The className string that will be applied to all nested ULs.

par.name: sLblLiClass
par.note: The className string that will be applied to all LIs which precede a nested UL (submenu). These are called 'labels'.

par.name: sItmLiClass
par.note: The className string that will be applied to all LIs which do not precede a nested UL. These are called 'items'.

par.name: sLblAClass
par.note: The className string that will be applied to all A elements in label LIs.

par.name: sItmAClass
par.note: The className string that will be applied to all A elements in item LIs.

par.name: sPlusImg
par.note: Optional. The URL string of the 'plus' image file.

par.name: sMinusImg
par.note: Optional. The URL string of the 'minus' image file.

par.name: sImgClass
par.note: Optional. The className string that will be applied to all plus/minus image elements.

par.name: sItmPadLeft
par.note: Optional. This should be a string, including units, suitable for assigning to 'style.paddingLeft' (for example: "2px"). If plus/minus images are being used, then sItmPadLeft can be used to control the 'indent' of 'A' items under their labels.

par.name: bLblIsItm
par.note: Optional. Boolean. If true, only a click on a plus/minus image will open/close sub-menus. The label's 'A' becomes a regular link. If false or undefined, a click on either the image or the label's 'A' will open/close a sub-menu and the label does not become a link.

par.name: sActiveItmId
par.note: Optional. String ID of A element which is the "active" item for the current page. If this is valid the menu will be auto-opened to this item.

meth.name: open(id)
meth.note: Opens the menu to the A element whose ID is given.

demo.note: A simple but effective technique for "auto open".

comment.note: You don't have to keep your own references to xMenu6 objects, they are stored in the static xMenu6.instances object.
